name: axiom

procedures: T1001.002::[Axiom] has used steganography to hide its C2 communications.
T1003::[Axiom] has been known to dump credentials.
T1005::[Axiom] has collected data from a compromised network.
T1021.001::[Axiom] has used RDP during operations.
T1078::[Axiom] has used previously compromised administrative accounts to escalate privileges.
T1189::[Axiom] has used watering hole attacks to gain access.
T1190::[Axiom] has been observed using SQL injection to gain access to systems.
T1203::[Axiom] has used exploits for multiple vulnerabilities including CVE-2014-0322, CVE-2012-4792, CVE-2012-1889, and CVE-2013-3893.
T1546.008::[Axiom] actors have been known to use the Sticky Keys replacement within RDP sessions to obtain persistence.
T1553::[Axiom] has used digital certificates to deliver malware.
T1560::[Axiom] has compressed and encrypted data prior to exfiltration.
T1563.002::[Axiom] has targeted victims with remote administration tools including RDP.
T1566::[Axiom] has used spear phishing to initially compromise victims.
T1583.002::[Axiom] has acquired dynamic DNS services for use in the targeting of intended victims.
T1583.003::[Axiom] has used VPS hosting providers in targeting of intended victims.
T1584.005::[Axiom] has used large groups of compromised machines for use as proxy nodes.

description: [Axiom](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0001) is a suspected Chinese cyber espionage group that has targeted the aerospace, defense, government, manufacturing, and media sectors since at least 2008. Some reporting suggests a degree of overlap between [Axiom](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0001) and [Winnti Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0044) but the two groups appear to be distinct based on differences in reporting on TTPs and targeting.(Citation: Kaspersky Winnti April 2013)(Citation: Kaspersky Winnti June 2015)(Citation: Novetta Winnti April 2015)
